- Sepsis, septic shock

- Abscesses of adjacent soft tissue

- Contiguous osteitis

- Joint destruction with functional sequelae

- Linked to bacteremia: infective endocarditis, other secondary localizations

question.title: What is a potential complication of acute septic arthritis?
question.description: A complication of acute septic arthritis in children and adults

option_a.title: Joint destruction with functional sequelae
option_a.description: A possible outcome of untreated septic arthritis

option_b.title: Infective endocarditis
option_b.description: A condition that can be caused by bacteremia

option_d.title: Septic shock
option_d.description: A life-threatening condition that can occur in response to sepsis

correct_option.title: Joint destruction with functional sequelae
correct_option.description: The correct answer, indicating a potential long-term consequence of untreated septic arthritis
